title: Color Slice
description: I designed this to use as my profile picture for my instagram dedicated to my art and Etsy, @lissalemon.

title: Piedmont Bird Calling Contest Poster 2017
description: My highschool's annual bird calling contest advertised with a unique poster each year. I entered and won with this design as a freshmen. This was some of my first experimentation with digital art.

title: Silly Little Bug
description: In order to promote The UC Theater's livestream that I would be featured in, I was asked to send a photo of myself to be posted on their Instagram. Using a few different photos of mine, I made a goofy edit playing on the title of my song, 'Silly Little Bug'.

title: Ghost Hand
description: As an experiment with brushes, layer blending, and shading, I illustrated this sort of ghostly image of a reaching hand. For reference, I used a free stock photo from Unsplash.

title: Uncertain Pigtails
description: It is always a lot of fun to play with facial expressions. I really love designing goofy abstract characters like these, and hope to build on that in the future.

title: Sea Glass Bouquet
description: I collect pretty bottles. As an item that I love, they make the perfect subject for practice challenging my fear of shading.

title: MotherBoat
description: For my first independent coding project, I made a site that would generate a name for a boat. As a play on words, I named it 'MotherBoat'. I designed this graphic to be a logo.

title: Ukulele Club Sticker
description: In high school I was president of the ukulele club. I gave out a few stickers with this doodle style design I made for the club. They were on a couple waterbottles.

title: PHS Dance Shirt Design
description: My high school dance class chose this design for our t-shirt. I posed a few doodly characters using class exercises and choreography from our upcoming show.

title: How To: Stop Motion
description: My video was a finalist for Next Vista's Creative Storm 2018 video contest. I chose to teach something that I am familiar with and very fond of, stop motion.

title: System
description: Due to COVID, my dance class did not get to perform live for my last show. All teaching, collaboration, and presenting had to be done remotely. This provided a unique opportunity. I made video tutorials to teach the choreography, and gave instructions for filming their parts. I chose to edit them together in an experimental arrangement to create an effect unique to digital media.
